document.heading: Third Amendment to the Revenue Act for Fiscal Year 1978 and Other Purposes

history.narrative: Law 2-73, the “Third Amendment to the Revenue Act for Fiscal Year 1978 and Other Purposes,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 2-206, which was referred to the Committee on Finance and Revenue. The Bill was adopted on first, amended first, and second readings on November 22, 1977, December 6, 1977 and January 10, 1978, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on February 9, 1978, it was assigned Act No. 2-149 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review.
